Sims are feeling creatures! Their current mood, or Emotion, has a big impact on what they do and how they do it. A positive Emotion may help your Sim to build Skills, develop Relationships, and get promoted in their Career. Negative Emotions, however, may cause your Sims to fail at things or stop them from doing those things altogether until they feel better.

The Sledgehammer is used to delete a lot of Objects or features quickly! Select the Sledgehammer and either click things individually, or click and drag to delete many things at once. Matzo Ball Soup isn't just a staple at many Pesach celebrations; it's also the food your bubbe or zayde might make for you when you're feeling a little under the weather as a cure-all.

The recipe for matzo ball soup has roots in Ashkenazi Jewish cooking in Eastern Europe and is a type of chicken soup with large dumplings made of matzah meal and eggs; the broth has what's known as schmaltz (chicken fat). Matzah on its own is a flatbread served at Pesach, when Jews refrain from eating leavened bread for the duration of the holiday as of a celebration of their escape from enslavement in Egypt.

Historically, the matzo balls have actually been called knoedel (or knaidel, or kneidel... exact spelling varies) instead of matzo. Now you can enjoy a soup that's as nourishing for the spirit and soul as it is for the body.

To modify and upgrade your home, there are some essential Build Mode tools you should know about.\n\nSelecting an existing Room by clicking on its floor or walls reveals arrows that allow you to change the shape of the room. You can also change Wall Height this way!

Once you’ve picked a Lot, you will get options to keep or sell your current furniture (keeping the furniture puts them in the Household Inventory) and whether to buy the new Lot furnished, unfurnished, or bulldozed. You can see your remaining funds under the Household portrait. If you’re moving to a Lot where someone already lives, you will get a choice whether to move in with them or evict them first. Finalize the move with the Purchase Home or Move In button!

You can change color, or swatch, on most Objects with the Design Tool. This is totally free!

The Select tool is used to select Objects and various architectural features such as Rooms and Roofs found on your Lot. Once selected, they can be moved, deleted, or (in the case of Rooms and Roofs) resized and reshaped. While using another tool, you can hit the [Esc] key on your keyboard to quickly return to the Select Tool.
Select Grandmother's Urn and engrave a few words to remember her by. This will complete the scenario.

The first time you encounter the World Select screen and the World Map, you’ll be moving your first Sims into their new home! Willow Creek and Oasis Springs are great worlds with empty houses longing for Sims of their own. When moving, the Lots you can afford are outlined in green. We suggest you pick a prebuilt house instead of an empty lot for your first home. Hover the cursor over the lots to see the selling price and amount of bedrooms and bathrooms.

Interact with other Sims to build Relationships with them. Select the other Sim and pick Social Interactions from the appropriate category (select More Choices in the menu to see the categories).\n\nThe outcome of Social Interactions largely depends on your Sim's Emotion. The Happy and Confident Emotions are great for making friends, while Flirty can improve your romantic advances.

Milestones mark memorable moments across a Sim's life. Hover over the different categories to learn more.\nSome categories and Milestones are only available for certain Life Stages. Select View Milestones to see all completed Milestones.

Objects that help you build Skills are also very useful. You can see which Skills an Object can raise in the Object’s tooltip. Some good examples are the chess table (Logic Skill), computer (Programming, Writing, Video Game Skills), mirror (Charisma Skill), instruments (Guitar, Violin, Piano Skills), bar (Mixology Skill), and garden pot (Gardening Skill). You can find most Skill Objects in the Activities and Skills category if you browse by Function.

A Sim’s Sexual Orientation is also set in the Customize menu under the Gender buttons. It's available for Sims who are Teens or older. You can set which gender(s) a Sim is attracted to romantically (who they can build a romantic relationship with) and which gender(s) they’re interested in Messing Around or having Woohoo with. For example, to make a biromantic and asexual Sim, set them to be romantically attracted to men and women, and to be interested in Woohoo with no gender. You can also decide if a Sim is exploring romantically; if not, they will turn down advances from Sims who aren’t of the gender(s) they’re attracted to.

The World Map is where you choose which Household to play or which Lot to edit, add new Households, and manage all the Households in the save. This view is also used when traveling.\n\nTo go to the World Map from Live Mode, use the Manage World button.

Is your garden blossoming? Ambrosia requires a Death Flower, so this week, you will also need to graft an Orchid and Pomegranate plant.

Work hard and play hard with animal friends and your own stretch of land in The Sims™ 4 Horse Ranch Expansion Pack! Raise, train, and form special bonds with majestic horses that are customizable members of your family. You can also care for mini sheep and mini goats, or make a living selling homemade Nectar. Carve out your own unique life on the ranch. Rockin' Rancher Digital Content:
  • 63' Twilight Notes Resonator Guitar
  • Softly Spoke n' Petals
  • The Rocking Star

Let’s talk about promotions! Promotions mean new rewards and better salaries. To get promoted, you need to fill the Performance bar and fulfill any Requirements (usually reaching specific Skill levels). The best ways to increase your Performance are completing your Daily Tasks and going to work with a positive Emotion. While they’re at work, you can also select the Away Action icon on Sim’s thumbnail and order them to Work Hard for an extra boost!

Every tassel has been found and the collection is complete. Khun Mae would be proud! Her story is also one that ended in victory, with the people of Tomarang cheering and showering their saviors in gifts and glory. For her bravery, Khun Mae was made Leader of the village. But as she rejoiced, she was also left bewildered by her sacrifice's outcome: a soul split in two. A tiger sat quietly in the crowd, watching her, waiting for her command. This tiger was special, as it now carried the other half of her soul. She knew they would be bonded for life, so she snipped a tassel from her shirt and tied it around its neck. The village embraced them both and Tomarang lived on in peace, thriving under The Great Mother and her other half. Legend has it, these are the very same tassels she once wore! Click on a tassel in your Sim's Inventory to combine all 10 colors into a special reward.

Hand-me-down furniture and forgotten favorites await in The Sims™ 4 Basement Treasures Kit. Sometimes the most beloved seat in the house is one that’s a little worn down. That’s why this collection is full of pieces with wear and tear from lots of use and love. Kit Features:
  • Just a Little Dusty — Sometimes you have to sift through the basement to uncover a few gems. They might look a little scuffed up, but they still have plenty of use and a whole lot of character.
  • Precious Memories – Add a little history to your décor. Do these items have sentimental value to your Sims or are they simply what they’re making do with? Maybe that was their mom’s favorite recliner, or their grandparents’ old television. Create new memories from the old.
Requires The Sims 4 & all game updates. See minimum system requirements for the pack.

If you don’t know what to do in the game, or want a challenge, you should try a Scenario! Scenarios kick off a story, give you additional goals and rewards, and may change some rules in the game. If you’re new to The Sims 4, we recommend the Welcome Scenarios: New in Town, Stuck in Their Shadow, and Parenting Predicaments.

Design an inspiring space for Sims to hone their creative skills with The Sims™ 4 Artist Studio Kit. Your easel is surrounded by the tools of your trade – brushes, paint cans, still life references and more all scattered artfully, just the way you like it. You know your studio – its clutter, its drawers and shelves, and every drop of splattered paint – because you’ve left your mark on it, just like your canvas. Kit Features:
  • An Artist’s Tools – Give your Sims more ways to express their creativity. There’s a new easel, tablet, and woodworking table for Sims to use in their artistic endeavors. Place inspiring still-life references, a backdrop, and other props to really help your creativity flow.
  • Artful Décor – Add an artistic flourish to your canvas and your studio. Add paint splatter to the ground and clutter items like palettes, cans, tubes, brushes, and stacked sketch books to every shelf and corner.

The Eyedropper is a very useful tool for buying a copy of something you already own, such as adding more chairs to a table! Simply select the Eyedropper from the menu at the top of the screen, select an Object in your house, and place the new copy. You can also use the Eyedropper as a shortcut to a specific Catalog category (for example, selecting a bed to open the Beds category).

A popular playstyle among Simmers (Sims fans) is playing the same family, generation after generation, and growing an impressive family tree! Some Sims want to be the best, maxing out as many Skills, Careers, and Aspirations as they can! A true virtuoso might work hard to climb the ranks of the Musician branch of the Entertainment Career while leveling every instrument Skill, while a foodie dedicates themselves to the Cooking, Gourmet Cooking, and Mixology Skills as well as the Food Aspirations. Mastering Skills is also a great way to make Simoleons; why not build your fortune creating masterpieces with the Painting Skill or hacking with the Programming Skill?

This section shows all active and broken rules for this unit. Property Owners can Post Fine using the mailbox or by selecting the Tenant unit's door. They may also select the Tenant Sim directly to Prosecute a Fine. Tenant Sims have the opportunity to Negotiate Rule Change for any of the active rules as long as it isn't broken. Be mindful that unpaid fines for broken Rules give the Property Owner a chance to Justly Evict the Tenant Household without any consequences.
